title: James Nesbitt credits £20k hair transplant with saving his career after balding in his 30s

James Nesbitt has been sporting a full head of hair recently – and now the Cold Feet star has revealed his secret. 
The 52-year-old actor has spent £20k on hair transplant surgery after starting to lose his hair in his 30s. 
And after getting help in the hair department, the Irish actor has seen a resurgence in his career with roles in The Hobbit, The Missing and the new series of Cold Feet. 
And now he credits the treatment with rebooting his career. James Nesbitt now has a full head of hair (Photo: Rex Features) 
“Well I went public with it. I was very happy to be open about it,” he told the Radio Times . 
“I just thought, ‘Come on, somebody is going to say it before I say it’. 
“It was something I struggled with. And that was probably the vanity in me. James Nesbitt in Cold Feet in 1997 (Photo: Rex Features) The Irish actor started going bald in his 30s (Photo: Rex Features) 
“But also career-wise it had an impact; in terms of the range of leading roles I’ve had since then it’s probably helped.” 
The Northern Ireland-born star admitted that he’s had his last treatment. 
“I’ve just had my last one. They take a strip from here [pointing to the nape of his neck], separate the hairs and put them back in. James Nesbitt with his now ex-wife Sonia in 2007 (Photo: Rex Features) James Nesbitt looked a bit thin on top 10 years ago (Photo: Rex Features) 
“The guy who does it is a genius. It’s not cheap… probably 20 grand.” 
But the actor has ruled out plastic surgery. 
“I think it’s such a shame. There always used to be the sense that age adds character,” he said. 
They have two grown-up daughters Peggy, 19, and Mary, 15. Like us on Facebook
